FuncDef: The pki http command configures the downloading of the CA certificate, local certificate, or CRL through HTTP.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the URL of the CA certificate, local certificate, or CRL.
It is a string of 1 to 255 characters and case sensitive.

Specifies the VPN instance to which the CA HTTP server belongs.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the name of the CA certificate, local certificate, or CRL that is saved to the CF card.
It is a string of 5 to 63 characters and case sensitive.

Specifies the local address that is used to download the CA certificate, local certificate, or CRL.
The value is in the IPv4 address format, and in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Note the following when the device downloads the CA certificate, local certificate, or CRL through HTTP:
The CA certificate or local certificate cannot exceed 2 MB, the CRL file cannot exceed 1 MB.There is sufficient space in the CF card for the CA certificate, local certificate, or CRL file.
